Description: The California Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program is a food and nutrition program for growing families.

Service name: Get access to healthy food with CalFresh
Description: CalFresh can help your family get access to healthy food. You can use CalFresh benefits at most grocery stores and even farmers markets to buy items such as bread, nuts, rice, and more.

Resources provided by California's Department of Insurance to assist with insurance issues brought about by the recent LA Wildfires.

Service name: One-year moratorium on loss of service
Description: State law prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance polices for one year in areas near a wildfire including total and no loss.

Find answers ot questions about 2024-2025 Los Angeles County fire victim tax relief.
Los Angeles County individuals and businesses impacted by fires that began on January 7, 2025, qualify for a postponement to file, and pay taxes until October 15, 2025.

Governor Newsom has suspended penalties and interest on late property tax payments for a year, effectively extending the state property tax deadline, for those living in communities impacted by the Los Angeles firestorms.

Service name: Property Reassessment and Base Year value transfer
Description: In the event of a fire, earthquake, or flooding damages or destroys your property, you may be eligible for property tax relief. In such cases, the county assessor will reappraise the property to reflect its damaged condition. In addition, when it is rebuilt in a like or similar manner, the property will retain its prior value (Proposition 13) for tax purposes.

Service name: Consumer Protections and Resources for Wildfire Victims
Description: The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) is reminding Californians that energy, natural gas, water, and telecommunication utilities must implement disaster relief protections for customers of affected areas during any state of emergency.
For counseling services in this time of crisis.
Resources to help small businesses and entrepreneurs. This includes financing, training, and advocacy.

Entity: California Department of Tax & Fee Administration
Description: Get relief from penalty, collection cost, and interest. You can also get copies of tax records and up to a 3- month filing extension on your tax returns.

Service name: Business income tax relief and filing extensions
Description: Businesses impacted by the wildfires may postpone filing and paying income taxes. The deadline for them is now October 15, 2025.

Service name: Employer payroll tax and reporting extensions
Description: California employers directly affected by an emergency or disaster may request an extension of up to two months to file their state payroll reports and to deposit state payroll taxes with the EDD, without penalty or interest.
